page.title: 02THE HISTORY OF ASHTON
page.content:
The original name of the village was { {Ashdown.}Local legend states that a line of ash trees originally stretched long the road from Helston to Penzance. Timber was required for pit props in the local mineral mines and these trees were cut down for use in the mines, hence its old name Ashdown. The centre of the present village is still on the site where two ancient trackways crossed.
Before motor transport two horse buses served the area, one being run by a Mr Jenkins who drove his bus from Helston to Penzance. The bus was pulled by four horses who remained unchanged along the fourteen mile route. The other bus ran between Porthleven and Ashton.
